email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, available with a DWT of 150,000 and LOA of 280m. The laycan is 15-20 October. The starting freight rate is in the low 50s ($50.50 per ton). Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than expected. Would you be able to come down to the mid-40s? Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concern about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $48.75 per ton. The demurrage rate is $25,000 per day, pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. $48.75 is more reasonable. However, could we push the laycan to 18-23 October? Also, can we cap the demurrage at $20,000 per day? Let me know if this is feasible. Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve confirmed with the owner. We can adjust the laycan to 18-23 October, and the demurrage can be capped at $20,000 per day. Let’s proceed with $48.75 per ton. Shall I draft the charter party agreement? Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, that sounds good. Please go ahead with the charter party agreement. Let’s aim to finalize by end of day. Thanks for your flexibility. Cheers, John.
